originalText.text: Very good experience . The front staff is very friendly . Easy to make an appointment. They gave me the time and date I asked for . very transparent pricing . clean , nice , the hygienist was very good and it did not hurt at all . She communicated well with me . the doctor was very prompt and did not up sell me at all, he also accommodated my schedule and made me feel taken care of . Fair prices , zero gimmicks , no  tv on the ceiling or shiny screens , very professional and I will def be back .

originalText.text:
I was a former long-time patient of a practice that Integrated Aesthetic Dentistry acquired and I came in to see them for a routine tooth cleaning (the appointment was actually with my previous Dr). In addition to the cleaning, they gave me thorough visual evaluation, and x-rays and although I found the cost to be relatively high, but I recognized that this covered more than just a cleaning, so I proceeded with paying.

Subsequently, they recommended a second visit for a deeper cleaning, which was performed not by a dentist, but by their dental hygienist. To my astonishment, the invoice for this visit was twice the amount of my initial visit -- and at quadruple what is a reasonable charge. I would not have gone had I been informed that the fee would be $1,100... for a cleaning. I would not have agreed to this treatment as I only discovered this after the hygienist was finished and I was billed. I never experienced this issue my previous dentists, in the 15-20+ years that I was their patient. I never needed to inquire about the charges before service was performed as their charges were always reasonable .

Deeply concerned about the billing, I attempted to reach out to their office to discuss the matter numerous times. I left messages via phone calls (three times) and text messages (three times) without receiving any response. Effective communication is crucial in any professional relationship, especially in health care. The lack of response to my multiple attempts to discuss my concerns about the exorbitant invoice reflects a lack of courtesy and responsiveness that I find disheartening. It also concerns me that should I require emergency service I would be unable to receive it. As a conscientious consumer, I could not justify continuing with a dental service that not only grossly overcharges its patients but also fails to address their concerns in a timely and respectful manner. I believe that fair pricing and open communication are fundamental aspects of any reputable health care practice.

originalText.text:
This was my first time using this dental service. The Dentist was Top Notch, and I felt very comfortable, surrounded by highly intelligent, and professional staff. Even though, everyone was young, the treatment I received, was as good as older, well seasoned doctors.
I know I’m in good hands with
Elizabeth Heindel DMD

originalText.text: You ever have a pain-free, one-day crown placement? I just did. Dr. Cafarella and his team are amazing! The lovely Gramercy Park office is conveniently located and tastefully styled. The ancillary team members (Tereza and Dario) are capable and kind. You might be hard-pressed to find someone more afraid of the dentist than I am. Was. Dario gave me my choice of background music and I hummed my way through the entire procedure. Dr. Cafarella walked me with baby steps through every stage of my first tear-free dental procedure. He gently prepared my tooth, took an impression, and used some high-tech program to create images and the crown. The crown was implanted, and I was back to work in no time. I never shared this with Dr. Cafarella, but I had a traumatic dental experience as a young child and have been terribly afraid of anything more than a cleaning since then. Had been. Based on yesterday’s personal experience, I recommend Dr. Cafarella to anyone who is afraid of the dentist and in pain.

originalText.text:
i have been a patient of Dr Scarmato for 17 years and never had ny issues. Until she sold her office to a group of dentists... integrated Aesthetic Dentistry, in January this year 2023. i gave it a try for few months but i will never come back... i have to say, today's visit was too much. i arrived 10 minutes before my appointment and no one was at the front desk (at 9:20)  so i'm standing up waiting when one of the staff arrived from outside and told me "Please take a seat". and then disappear in the back. A second Staff member arrive and not a word.
until the first one came back to tell me to follow her. The coldest welcome possible. Like if i was transparent...

i was here for a teeth cleaning but she said let's do an  X-ray. i said no, I'm hear just for a cleaning! she said i was due for an X-ray ad mine was September LY. I did it against my will... unnecessary practice. Because they also did some new ones in February... Last time I came there they wanted me to change or redo about 4 to 5 of my crowns, and at least this time we were down to 2 ... not serious at all... after my last visit they sent me asap an estimate for the work and was keep getting a reminder (like several times) for sending them a response for a 6000 dollars work , most of it not covered because they take only one insurance...

they are all after your money, not your experience.
